title: Latest Thunderbird Update 139.0 (20250522211142) Dated May 27, 2025 has stopped updating AT&T email
content:
Latest Thunderbird update 139.0 (20250522211142) dated May 27, 2025 has stopped updating AT&T email. AT&T email setup as IMAP and has worked for the past 6 months with no issues. On May 27 new emails have stopped being received after the latest update. The online AT&T Yahoo email app continues to function and updates to current emails received and sent. The Email and password have not changed. No other settings have changed. Anyone else having this issue?

If this cannot be corrected, I cannot continue using Thunderbird. Help!
creator: s.geer

title: Repeat requests to signin on googleapis via TB after deleting account from TB
content: I recently deleted a gmail account from my TB. It was a shared account so that account is still open but I have no more need of accessing it. Suddenly, and constantly, I have this window pop up, requesting my login info, which I no longer have. When I close the window, it just opens back up. I have to close it in order to get to my main TB window. It's horribly frustrating. Any ideas??

title: Errors when creating a calendar event discard your work
content:
Hi, I've encountered a problem where if any error occurs when you try to create a new calendar event (I.e. Thunderbird cannot connect to the CalDav server), it will give you an error pop-up and discard everything you have input.

Losing work like this is extremely annoying and I think what should happen when an error occurs is that Thunderbird would go back to the event creation popup, preserving everything that was input into it, and let you try to create the event again (perhaps save it into a different calendar).

I'm not sure if this is the best place to ask about this but it was the most easily accessible place I could find.

This happened in Thunderbird desktop version 138.
creator: luna8

title: need help in consolidating profiles
content:
Several years ago, I switched over to the beta path of Thunderbird... In doing so, I created a new profile for the beta installation, leaving the old one behind in case I wanted to abandon beta... So I had two profile folders; I *thought* they were this:

current profile: c: otes\Thunderbird original backup profile: c: otes\Thunderbird.b115

Now, I've decided that there is no reason to retain the old Thunderbird profile folder, since I'm clearly committed to the beta path... however, I have discovered an anomaly... *both* the old and new profiles are periodically being updated!! Thunderbird.b115 is apparently actually my active profile, but Thunderbird was updated just a few days ago.

When I look at About Profiles, I actually see *three* profile folders listed:

Profile: Gorlash: (default: no) c: otes\Thunderbird

Profile: Derell Licht beta: (default: no) c: otes\Thunderbird

Profile: Thunderbird beta (default: no) c: otes\Thunderbird.beta (note that this folder does not exist)

Profile: Thunderbird b115: (default: yes) c: otes\Thunderbird.b115

===========================================

Is there something that I could do to consolidate all of this into just one folder? I don't even *know* what those Gorlash and Derell Licht profiles refer to... Yes, those are both usernames that I use online, in various contexts, but as far as I know, I don't use them in Thunderbird...

Q1: Can I just delete those other profiles where default is NO ?? Q2: Why is c: otes\Thunderbird still getting periodic updates, even though those profiles are not default??
creator: dan7miller
